author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

[This doesn't seem quite ready for registration yet:](https://github.com/CliMA/UnrolledUtilities.jl/blob/78c2be01faf0f97a8c43ebedce716e767feaece7/src/UnrolledUtilities.jl#L3):

```
module UnrolledUtilities

# TODO: Add source code.

end
```

Please also make sure to add some documentation, like a list of functions this provides.

I was hoping to work on the source code and docs in a separate PR while the three day timer is running. Sorry if this is bad practice; I can close this and re-register in a day or two once I've added in everything.

> I was hoping to work on the source code and docs in a separate PR while the three day timer is running.

Sneaky, but I certainly understand the impulse ;-)

> Sorry if this is bad practice; I can close this and re-register in a day or two once I've added in everything.

Yeah, that would probably be proper thing to do. Let's do that. I don't see this shaping up as anything controversial, but out of fairness, it would be best to do the registration once it meets the minimum criteria, and then give the community the standard 3-day period for feedback.

So I'm going to close this, but just resubmit as soon as you have the code and README in place.

body:
- Registering package: UnrolledUtilities

- Version: v0.1.0

- Reference: https://github.com/CliMA/UnrolledUtilities.jl/commit/78c2be01faf0f97a8c43ebedce716e767feaece7#commitcomment-140264709
- Description: A Julia package that provides unrolled analogues to functions from `Base` and `Base.Iterators`
<!--  -->
title: New package: UnrolledUtilities v0.1.0
